newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine car output rose 29 percent in May.
newsitem.headline: Argentine car output rose 29 percent in May.

text.p: Argentine car production in May reached 38,440 units, an increase of 29.3 percent from May last year and of 6.7 percent from April this year, industry lobby ADEFA said Wednesday.
Sales totalled 37,272 units, which was 23.5 percent up on May last year and four percent higher than April this year.
Auto production for the first five months of the year was 40 percent higher than the same period last year. Sales for the January-May period improved 15.1 percent.

ADEFA said exports reached 16,679 units, which was 56 percent higher than May last year and 14.1 percent up on April. For the first five months of 1997, exports improved 91.7 percent compared with January-May 1996.
